Description:
Job Summary:The Personnel Lead will oversee global personnel aspects that include, but are not limited to labor law compliance in countries we are currently established in, providing comprehensive opinion based on research and analysis of labor law in countries we are looking to become established, and managing, creating, updating and implementing company policies and procedures. In addition, the candidate will manage the documentation of Avertra's employees, as well as liaising with other internal departments to review areas of non-compliance or required enhancements.. This position requires someone with a persistent and motivated personality, extremely detail-oriented, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and strong administrative skills.Job Responsibilities:Oversee personnel records and document compliance (e.g. Employee Contracts)
Manage/create/update/implement/communicate policies and procedures.
Work with Operations Lead/Legal Counsel to maintain and circulate documents related to Avertra’s policies and procedures that impact the personnel of Avertra.
Oversee onboarding/off-boarding from a compliance perspective only
Work with the Operations Lead/Legal Counsel to keep abreast of Labor Laws and collective bargaining in countries we are establishing in
Participate in meetings between labor and management
Liaising with Talent Management to develop and onboarding documentation l from a compliance perspective
Research best practices in human performance designs and systems.
Liaise with the other departments to facilitate processes and procedures.
Assist management during crisis situations, such as labor strikes or high risk employee liability issues, to facilitate effective negotiations and resolve issues quickly
Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.Skills
Skills:
Expert attention to detail
Organizational skills
Negotiation skills
Excellent research skills
Excellent documentation skills in English and Arabic
Excellent Communication skills
Leadership skills
Team player
Motivated and determined 
Proven ability to meet deadlines
Objective, fair-minded person to mediate disputes
Ability to make initiatives
Firm understanding of legal contract language

Ability to handle multiple issues and conflicts.
Knowledge of Jordanian Labor and SSC laws and legislations
Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time efficiently
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Excellent verbal and written English language.
Must be willing to be hands-on

Have worked in a multinational company
Knowledge or ability to learn of US/UAE/India culture and labor laws
Might need to travel to the US, India, or UAE as internal tasks dictate but not probable
Flexible hours to cover all Avertra branch locations

You’ll join a global family of awesome, passionate people that are working together to build a sustainable, scalable ecosystem committed to using logic to create a better experience.
We want you to help us become better. You will be empowered to drive change and innovate.
That we will invest in you. We will give you the opportunity to master your domain and drive excellence.
